title: Interprofessional Learning Course for Developing Clinical Guidelines on Coercive Treatment in Psychiatry

context.prior_knowledge: Comprehension of core concepts and intermediate-level application skills
context.additional_context: Strengthening competency in developing clinical guidelines reflecting gender/sex factors through multidisciplinary team-based collaborative learning

learning_goals: Deriving an ethical decision-making framework that considers sex/gender differences in involuntary psychiatric treatment scenarios.

Learners will integrate perspectives from at least three professional groups (e.g., physicians, nurses, physical therapists) to draft a patient-centered clinical guideline for a single patient case, following a 5-stage structure: assessment, goal-setting, intervention, evaluation, and adjustment.
Apply a fairness verification method for coercive treatment guidelines through power dynamics analysis
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
